Diploma in Critical Care Management (DCCM) - Master Curriculum

1Ô∏è‚É£ Course Overview

Course Introduction: The Diploma in Critical Care Management (DCCM) is an intensive academic and practical training program designed to equip allied healthcare professionals with advanced knowledge in intensive care unit (ICU) operations, critical patient monitoring, and life-support management.

  • Objectives: To train competent critical care technicians capable of assisting intensivists and managing critical care telemetry, ventilators, and emergency responses.
  • Duration: 2 Years (4 Semesters)
  • Eligibility Criteria: 10+2 with Science (PCB) / Equivalent Medical Vocational background.
  • Learning Outcomes: Mastery over ICU equipment handling, BLS/ACLS protocols, critical care pharmacology administration, and end-of-life care ethics.
  • Professional Scope: Immediate hiring in tertiary hospital ICUs, MICUs, SICUs, and specialized trauma centers.
  • Industry Relevance: High demand globally due to the expansion of intensive care facilities and an aging population requiring critical intervention.

2Ô∏è‚É£ Academic Structure

Semester-wise Structure (4 Semesters):

  • Semester 1: Anatomy & Physiology, Basics of Critical Care, Medical Ethics. (15 Credits, 200 Contact Hours)
  • Semester 2: Applied Pharmacology in ICU, Monitoring Devices & Telemetry, Infection Control & CSSD Protocols. (18 Credits, 250 Contact Hours)
  • Semester 3: Ventilator Management, Advanced Trauma Life Support, Practical Clinical Postings (ICU). (20 Credits, 300 Contact Hours)
  • Semester 4: Specialized critical care (Neonatal & Cardiac), 6-Month Mandatory Internship, Final Project. (25 Credits, 400 Contact Hours)

3Ô∏è‚É£ Subject-Wise Detailed Syllabus

Unit: Ventilator Management (Sem 3)

  • Topic Breakdown: Modes of ventilation (AC, SIMV, CPAP), ABG (Arterial Blood Gas) analysis, weaning protocols, airway management (intubation assistance).
  • Learning Objectives: To independently setup, calibrate, and troubleshoot mechanical ventilators under physician guidance.
  • Practical Competencies: Endotracheal tube suctioning, attaching ETCO2 monitors, changing ventilator circuits.
  • Equipment Required: Mechanical ventilator, Ambu bags, Suction apparatus, ABG analyzers.

4Ô∏è‚É£ Practical / Clinical Component

  • Lab-based Training: Simulation of Code Blue responses using high-fidelity mannequins.
  • Hospital Rotations: ICU, Emergency Department, and High Dependency Units (HDU).
  • Hands-on Procedures: Foley catheter care, central line assisting, ECG hookups, and defibrillator preparation.
  • Infection Control: PPE donning/doffing, managing isolation wards (VAP/CLABSI prevention).

5Ô∏è‚É£ Internship / Field Training Requirements

  • Duration: 6 Months (Semester 4 embedded)
  • Posting Departments: Medical ICU (MICU), Surgical ICU (SICU), Emergency.
  • Minimum Requirements: 50 successful ABG draws assisted, 30 intubations assisted, 100 hours of continuous telemetric monitoring.
  • Evaluation: Weekly supervisor logbook sign-offs and final objective structured clinical examination (OSCE).

6Ô∏è‚É£ Assessment Structure

  • Internal Assessment (30%): Weekly continuous evaluation, viva voce, simulation lab performance.
  • External Examination (70%): Written theory exams and external practical clinical evaluation.
  • Grading System: SGPA based on standard UGC/medical council 10-point scales.
  • Attendance: Minimum 85% attendance required in clinical rotations to qualify for finals.

7Ô∏è‚É£ Required Documentation Templates

(Templates available to students in portal):

  • ICU Daily Monitoring Flowsheet
  • Clinical Logbook & Competency Tracker
  • Internship Completion Certificate Format
  • Code Blue Audit Form

üöÄ CAREER & FUTURE GROWTH

  • Higher Education: B.Sc. in Critical Care Technology, PG Diploma in Respiratory Therapy.
  • Government Jobs: AIIMS / State Govt Hospitals as ICU Technologists, NHM emergency response teams.
  • Private Sector: Corporate Hospitals (Apollo, Fortis, Max) as Senior Critical Care Technicians.
  • Entrepreneurship: Not directly applicable for clinical practice, but opportunities exist in home-ICU setup consulting and medical equipment supply.
  • Certifications: Mandatory BLS/ACLS via AHA.
  • Salary Range: ‚Çπ18,000 - ‚Çπ25,000/month (Entry-level, India). Highly scalable with experience.

üéì STUDENT ENGAGEMENT CONTENT

  • Certifications to Pursue: Advanced Cardiovascular Life Support (ACLS), Basic Life Support (BLS).
  • Seminars: "The Future of Non-Invasive Ventilation", "Sepsis Protocol Updates".
  • Monthly Challenge: Month 1: ABG Interpretation speed drill. Month 2: Infection control hand-washing audit.

Diploma in Hospital Management (DHM) - Master Curriculum

1Ô∏è‚É£ Course Overview

Course Introduction: The Diploma in Hospital Management (DHM) is structured to train administrative personnel to seamlessly manage the operational, financial, and quality assurance aspects of modern healthcare facilities.

  • Objectives: To bridge the gap between clinical care and administrative efficiency by training professionals in hospital operations and patient flow management.
  • Duration: 2 Years (4 Semesters)
  • Eligibility Criteria: 10+2 in any stream (Science/Commerce/Arts) with basic English & Computer proficiency.
  • Professional Scope: Front desk management, billing, patient relations, TPA/Insurance desks, and operational supervision.
  • Industry Relevance: Hospitals are shifting from doctor-managed administration to professional corporate management models, creating a huge administrative employment gap.

2Ô∏è‚É£ Academic Structure

Semester-wise Structure (4 Semesters):

  • Semester 1: Introduction to Hospital Administration, Business Communication, Principles of Management. (15 Credits)
  • Semester 2: Medical Terminology & Basic Anatomy, Hospital Information Systems (HIS), Front Office & OPD Management. (18 Credits)
  • Semester 3: Healthcare Financial Management & Billing, Medical Record Management (MRD), Quality Assurance & NABH Basics. (20 Credits)
  • Semester 4: Human Resource Management in Healthcare, Medico-Legal Issues, 6-Month Practical Internship. (25 Credits)

3Ô∏è‚É£ Subject-Wise Detailed Syllabus

Unit: Quality Assurance & NABH Basics (Sem 3)

  • Topic Breakdown: Introduction to National Accreditation Board for Hospitals & Healthcare Providers (NABH), standard operating procedures (SOPs), patient safety goals, incident reporting.
  • Learning Objectives: To understand how a hospital maintains quality of care and compliance with statutory audits.
  • Skill Outcomes: Ability to assist Quality Managers in conducting internal audits and maintaining compliance registers.

4Ô∏è‚É£ Practical / Clinical Component

  • Hospital Rotations: OPD Registration Desk, Internal Billing/TPA desk, Medical Records Department (MRD).
  • Hands-on Procedures: Using Hospital Information System (HIS) software to admit, discharge, and bill patients. Handling patient grievances.
  • Documentation: Learning to file medicolegal cases (MLC) and process insurance claims (Ayushman Bharat, private TPAs).

5Ô∏è‚É£ Internship / Field Training Requirements

  • Duration: 6 Months.
  • Posting Departments: Billing, TPA/Insurance, Quality Assurance, HR, and Patient Experience.
  • Requirements: Managing at least 100 successful insurance pre-authorizations and participating in one internal hospital audit.

6Ô∏è‚É£ Assessment Structure

  • Internal Assessment (40%): Case studies, role-play testing (angry patient handling), software competency tests.
  • External Examination (60%): End-semester theoretical exams and project presentation.

üöÄ CAREER & FUTURE GROWTH

  • Higher Education: Bachelor‚Äôs in Hospital Administration (BHA), MBA in Healthcare Management.
  • Private Sector: Patient Care Coordinator, TPA Executive, Billing Officer, Floor Manager in corporate hospital chains.
  • Entrepreneurship: Healthcare consulting setup, medical transcription business, third-party medical billing company.
  • Certifications: NABH Internal Assessor Course, Six Sigma in Healthcare (Green Belt).
  • Salary Range: ‚Çπ15,000 - ‚Çπ22,000/month initially, fast-tracking to ‚Çπ40k+ as Operations Managers.

üéì STUDENT ENGAGEMENT CONTENT

  • Seminars: "The impact of AI on Electronic Medical Records", "Navigating Medico-Legal Ethics in India".
  • Project Ideas: Auditing wait times in the OPD to propose optimization strategies.
  • Monthly Challenge: Month 1: Master 100 medical terms. Month 2: Complete a dummy NABH checklist audit for a mock ward.

Diploma in Anaesthesia Technology (DAT) - Master Curriculum

1Ô∏è‚É£ Course Overview

Course Introduction: The Diploma in Anaesthesia Technology (DAT) is a specialized paramedical course enabling students to assist anaesthesiologists in preparing patients for surgery, maintaining equipment, and monitoring intra-operative vitals.

  • Objectives: To produce highly skilled anaesthesia technicians compliant with safe surgical protocols and emergency resuscitation.
  • Duration: 2 Years (4 Semesters)
  • Eligibility Criteria: 10+2 Science (PCB preferred) with minimum 50% aggregate.
  • Professional Scope: Immediate placements in Operation Theatres (OT), surgical day-care centers, and intensive care setups.

2Ô∏è‚É£ Academic Structure

Semester-wise Structure:

  • Semester 1: Human Anatomy, Physiology, Basic Pharmacy, Sterilization Techniques. (15 Credits)
  • Semester 2: Anaesthesia Equipment Setup, Medical Gas Systems, ECG & Vital Monitoring. (18 Credits)
  • Semester 3: Applied Pharmacology of Anaesthetics, Regional vs General Anaesthesia, CPR & Emergency Protocols. (20 Credits)
  • Semester 4: Post-Anaesthesia Care Unit (PACU) Management, Mandatory OT Internship. (25 Credits)

3Ô∏è‚É£ Subject-Wise Detailed Syllabus

Unit: Anaesthesia Equipment Setup (Sem 2)

  • Topic Breakdown: Boyle‚Äôs machine structure, specific color-coding of medical cylinders, vaporizer calibration, breathing circuits (Bain, Magill).
  • Competencies: Performing the daily safety check on the anaesthesia workstation before the first surgically scheduled case.
  • Equipment Required: Standard anaesthesia workstation, oxygen cylinders, multipara monitors.

4Ô∏è‚É£ Practical / Clinical Component

  • Hospital Rotations: Pre-operative assessment room, Main OT, PACU (Recovery).
  • Procedures: Preparing the intubation tray (Laryngoscope, ET tubes, stylets), assisting in spinal block positioning, safe disposal of anesthetic waste.

5Ô∏è‚É£ Internship / Field Training Requirements

  • Duration: 6 Months in active major/minor OT theaters.
  • Requirements: Preparation of the anaesthesia trolley for 50 major surgeries under supervision.

üöÄ CAREER & FUTURE GROWTH

  • Higher Education: B.Sc in Anaesthesia and Operation Theatre Technology.
  • Government Jobs: OT Technician roles in AIIMS, ESI, Rail Hospitals.
  • Corporate Roles: Specializing in cardiac/neuro anaesthesia technology in private chains.
  • Certifications: BLS & ACLS mandatory.
  • Salary Range: ‚Çπ20,000 - ‚Çπ28,000/month in Tier-1 cities.

üéì STUDENT ENGAGEMENT CONTENT

  • Workshop: "Handling Difficult Airways" with simulation mannequins.
  • Case Studies: Analyzing malignant hyperthermia emergency responses.

Diploma in Community Care Provider (DCP) - Master Curriculum

1Ô∏è‚É£ Course Overview

Course Introduction: DCP trains frontline healthcare workers to deliver essential preventive, promotive, and curative health services at the grassroots/community level.

  • Objectives: To create health advocates equipped for rural and urban outreach, maternal-child health tracking, and communicable disease prevention.
  • Duration: 2 Years (4 Semesters)
  • Scope: Vital for rural public health (PHCs, CHCs) and NGO medical missions.

2Ô∏è‚É£ Academic Structure

  • Semester 1: Fundamentals of Public Health, Anatomy Basics, Nutrition.
  • Semester 2: Maternal & Child Health, Immunization Schedules, First Aid & Triage.
  • Semester 3: Communicable and Non-Communicable Diseases, Family Planning, Community Sanitation.
  • Semester 4: Community Field Internship, Demography & Surveying, Health Reporting.

3Ô∏è‚É£ Practical / Clinical Component

  • Field Work: Conducting door-to-door health surveys, anthropometric measurements of infants, ORS preparation, organizing vaccination drives under medical officers.

üöÄ CAREER & FUTURE GROWTH

  • Government Jobs: ASHA supervisor, Anganwadi roles, NHM cluster coordinator.
  • Private Sector: CSR initiatives of MNCs, NGOs (WHO, UNICEF partner programs).
  • Salary Range: ‚Çπ12,000 - ‚Çπ18,000/month (base) + field allowances.

Diploma in Emergency & Trauma Care Technician (DETC) - Master Curriculum

1Ô∏è‚É£ Course Overview

Course Introduction: Focuses on the immediate golden-hour management of critically injured and medically unstable patients both pre-hospital (ambulance) and in-hospital (triage/casualty)..

  • Objectives: Fast response triage, hemorrhage control, immobilization, and emergency drug administration protocols.
  • Duration: 2 Years (4 Semesters)

2Ô∏è‚É£ Academic Structure

  • Semester 1: Anatomy, Transport Physiology, Basic Life Support.
  • Semester 2: Mechanism of Injury, Shock Management, Orthopedic Triage (Splinting).
  • Semester 3: Advanced Cardiovascular Life Support (ACLS), Medical Emergencies (Tox/Neuro), Ambulance Ops.
  • Semester 4: ED Internship, Triage Coding, Disaster Management.

3Ô∏è‚É£ Practical / Clinical Component

  • Hospital Rotations: Ambulance shadowing, Casualty Ward, Trauma OT.
  • Procedures: Cervical collar application, long-board transfer, massive hemorrhage control, IV cannulation.

üöÄ CAREER & FUTURE GROWTH

  • Jobs: Ambulance EMTs, Corporate Hospital Casualty wings, Disaster relief forces.
  • Higher Ed: B.Sc in Emergency Medical Technology.
  • Certifications: International Trauma Life Support (ITLS).
  • Salary: ‚Çπ18,000 - ‚Çπ25,000/month.
